title: UdpSocket requires bind at all costs causing unnecessary permission prompt on macos
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
use std::net::UdpSocket;
use std::net::Ipv4Addr;

fn main() {
        let socket = UdpSocket::bind((Ipv4Addr::new(0, 0, 0, 0), 0)).expect("Failed to create socket");
        socket.set_broadcast(true).expect("Failed to enable broadcast");
        socket.send_to(b"TEST", (Ipv4Addr::BROADCAST, 9998)).expect("Failed to send broadcast packet");
}
```

I expected to see this happen: no permission prompt because the socket is never EVER used for listening, but only for sending a BROADCAST packet.

Instead, this happened: permission prompt for listening on macOS because bind was requested...

EDIT: I propose to add a new function (maybe `UdpSocket::new`) to create an UdpSocket without binding to any address to cover this use case.
